speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: SCENE II. The same. The council-chamber.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Cornets. Enter KING HENRY VIII, leaning on  CARDINAL WOLSEY's shoulder, the Nobles, and LOVELL;  CARDINAL WOLSEY places himself under KING HENRY VIII's feet on his right side

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: My life itself, and the best heart of it,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Thanks you for this great care: I stood i' the level

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Of a full-charged confederacy, and give thanks

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To you that choked it. Let be call'd before us

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: That gentleman of Buckingham's; in person

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I'll hear him his confessions justify;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And point by point the treasons of his master

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: He shall again relate.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: A noise within, crying 'Room for the Queen!' Enter  QUEEN KATHARINE, ushered by NORFOLK, and SUFFOLK:  she kneels. KING HENRY VIII riseth from his state, takes her up, kisses and placeth her by him

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Nay, we must longer kneel: I am a suitor.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Arise, and take place by us: half your suit

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Never name to us; you have half our power:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The other moiety, ere you ask, is given;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Repeat your will and take it.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Thank your majesty.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: That you would love yourself, and in that love

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Not unconsider'd leave your honour, nor

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: The dignity of your office, is the point

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Of my petition.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Lady mine, proceed.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I am solicited, not by a few,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: And those of true condition, that your subjects

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Are in great grievance: there have been commissions

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Sent down among 'em, which hath flaw'd the heart

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Of all their loyalties: wherein, although,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: My good lord cardinal, they vent reproaches

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Most bitterly on you, as putter on

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Of these exactions, yet the king our master--

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Whose honour heaven shield from soil!--even he

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: escapes not

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Language unmannerly, yea, such which breaks

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: The sides of loyalty, and almost appears

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: In loud rebellion.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Not almost appears,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: It doth appear; for, upon these taxations,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: The clothiers all, not able to maintain

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: The many to them longing, have put off

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: The spinsters, carders, fullers, weavers, who,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Unfit for other life, compell'd by hunger

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: And lack of other means, in desperate manner

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Daring the event to the teeth, are all in uproar,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: And danger serves among then!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Taxation!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Wherein? and what taxation? My lord cardinal,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: You that are blamed for it alike with us,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Know you of this taxation?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Please you, sir,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I know but of a single part, in aught

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Pertains to the state; and front but in that file

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Where others tell steps with me.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: No, my lord,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: You know no more than others; but you frame

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Things that are known alike; which are not wholesome

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: To those which would not know them, and yet must

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Perforce be their acquaintance. These exactions,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Whereof my sovereign would have note, they are

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Most pestilent to the bearing; and, to bear 'em,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: The back is sacrifice to the load. They say

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: They are devised by you; or else you suffer

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Too hard an exclamation.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Still exaction!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The nature of it? in what kind, let's know,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Is this exaction?

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I am much too venturous

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: In tempting of your patience; but am bolden'd

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Under your promised pardon. The subjects' grief

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Comes through commissions, which compel from each

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: The sixth part of his substance, to be levied

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Without delay; and the pretence for this

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Is named, your wars in France: this makes bold mouths:

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Tongues spit their duties out, and cold hearts freeze

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Allegiance in them; their curses now

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Live where their prayers did: and it's come to pass,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: This tractable obedience is a slave

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: To each incensed will. I would your highness

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Would give it quick consideration, for

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: There is no primer business.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: By my life,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: This is against our pleasure.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And for me,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I have no further gone in this than by

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: A single voice; and that not pass'd me but

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: By learned approbation of the judges. If I am

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Traduced by ignorant tongues, which neither know

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: My faculties nor person, yet will be

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The chronicles of my doing, let me say

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: 'Tis but the fate of place, and the rough brake

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: That virtue must go through. We must not stint

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Our necessary actions, in the fear

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: To cope malicious censurers; which ever,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: As ravenous fishes, do a vessel follow

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: That is new-trimm'd, but benefit no further

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Than vainly longing. What we oft do best,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: By sick interpreters, once weak ones, is

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Not ours, or not allow'd; what worst, as oft,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Hitting a grosser quality, is cried up

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: For our best act. If we shall stand still,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: In fear our motion will be mock'd or carp'd at,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: We should take root here where we sit, or sit

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: State-statues only.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Things done well,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And with a care, exempt themselves from fear;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Things done without example, in their issue

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Are to be fear'd. Have you a precedent

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Of this commission? I believe, not any.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: We must not rend our subjects from our laws,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And stick them in our will. Sixth part of each?

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: A trembling contribution! Why, we take

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: From every tree lop, bark, and part o' the timber;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And, though we leave it with a root, thus hack'd,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The air will drink the sap. To every county

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Where this is question'd send our letters, with

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Free pardon to each man that has denied

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The force of this commission: pray, look to't;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I put it to your care.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: A word with you.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: To the Secretary

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Let there be letters writ to every shire,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Of the king's grace and pardon. The grieved commons

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Hardly conceive of me; let it be noised

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: That through our intercession this revokement

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And pardon comes: I shall anon advise you

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Further in the proceeding.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Exit Secretary

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Enter Surveyor

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I am sorry that the Duke of Buckingham

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Is run in your displeasure.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: It grieves many:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The gentleman is learn'd, and a most rare speaker;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To nature none more bound; his training such,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: That he may furnish and instruct great teachers,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And never seek for aid out of himself. Yet see,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: When these so noble benefits shall prove

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Not well disposed, the mind growing once corrupt,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: They turn to vicious forms, ten times more ugly

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Than ever they were fair. This man so complete,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Who was enroll'd 'mongst wonders, and when we,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Almost with ravish'd listening, could not find

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: His hour of speech a minute; he, my lady,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Hath into monstrous habits put the graces

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: That once were his, and is become as black

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: As if besmear'd in hell. Sit by us; you shall hear--

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: This was his gentleman in trust--of him

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Things to strike honour sad. Bid him recount

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The fore-recited practises; whereof

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: We cannot feel too little, hear too much.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Stand forth, and with bold spirit relate what you,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Most like a careful subject, have collected

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Out of the Duke of Buckingham.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Speak freely.

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: First, it was usual with him, every day

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: It would infect his speech, that if the king

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Should without issue die, he'll carry it so

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: To make the sceptre his: these very words

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: I've heard him utter to his son-in-law,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Lord Abergavenny; to whom by oath he menaced

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Revenge upon the cardinal.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Please your highness, note

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: This dangerous conception in this point.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Not friended by by his wish, to your high person

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: His will is most malignant; and it stretches

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Beyond you, to your friends.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: My learn'd lord cardinal,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Deliver all with charity.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Speak on:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: How grounded he his title to the crown,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Upon our fail? to this point hast thou heard him

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: At any time speak aught?

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: He was brought to this

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: By a vain prophecy of Nicholas Hopkins.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: What was that Hopkins?

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Sir, a Chartreux friar,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: His confessor, who fed him every minute

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: With words of sovereignty.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: How know'st thou this?

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Not long before your highness sped to France,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: The duke being at the Rose, within the parish

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Saint Lawrence Poultney, did of me demand

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: What was the speech among the Londoners

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Concerning the French journey: I replied,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Men fear'd the French would prove perfidious,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: To the king's danger. Presently the duke

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Said, 'twas the fear, indeed; and that he doubted

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: 'Twould prove the verity of certain words

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Spoke by a holy monk; 'that oft,' says he,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: 'Hath sent to me, wishing me to permit

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: John de la Car, my chaplain, a choice hour

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: To hear from him a matter of some moment:

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Whom after under the confession's seal

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: He solemnly had sworn, that what he spoke

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: My chaplain to no creature living, but

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: To me, should utter, with demure confidence

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: This pausingly ensued: neither the king nor's heirs,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Tell you the duke, shall prosper: bid him strive

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: To gain the love o' the commonalty: the duke

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Shall govern England.'

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: If I know you well,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: You were the duke's surveyor, and lost your office

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: On the complaint o' the tenants: take good heed

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: You charge not in your spleen a noble person

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: And spoil your nobler soul: I say, take heed;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Yes, heartily beseech you.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Let him on.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Go forward.

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: On my soul, I'll speak but truth.

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: I told my lord the duke, by the devil's illusions

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: The monk might be deceived; and that 'twas dangerous for him

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: To ruminate on this so far, until

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: It forged him some design, which, being believed,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: It was much like to do: he answer'd, 'Tush,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: It can do me no damage;' adding further,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: That, had the king in his last sickness fail'd,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: The cardinal's and Sir Thomas Lovell's heads

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Should have gone off.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Ha! what, so rank? Ah ha!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: There's mischief in this man: canst thou say further?

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: I can, my liege.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Proceed.

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Being at Greenwich,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: After your highness had reproved the duke

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: About Sir William Blomer,--

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I remember

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Of such a time: being my sworn servant,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The duke retain'd him his. But on; what hence?

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: 'If,' quoth he, 'I for this had been committed,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: As, to the Tower, I thought, I would have play'd

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: The part my father meant to act upon

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: The usurper Richard; who, being at Salisbury,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Made suit to come in's presence; which if granted,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: As he made semblance of his duty, would

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Have put his knife to him.'

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: A giant traitor!

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Now, madam, may his highness live in freedom,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: and this man out of prison?

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: God mend all!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: There's something more would out of thee; what say'st?

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: After 'the duke his father,' with 'the knife,'

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: He stretch'd him, and, with one hand on his dagger,

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Another spread on's breast, mounting his eyes

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: He did discharge a horrible oath; whose tenor

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Was,--were he evil used, he would outgo

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: His father by as much as a performance

speaker: Surveyor
text_entry: Does an irresolute purpose.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: There's his period,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To sheathe his knife in us. He is attach'd;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Call him to present trial: if he may

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Find mercy in the law, 'tis his: if none,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Let him not seek 't of us: by day and night,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: He's traitor to the height.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Exeunt
